required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Acupuncture for Stress-predominant Mixed Urinary Incontinence
clinical_study.official_title: Electroacupuncture for Stress-predominant Mixed Urinary Incontinence: a Three-armed Randomized Controlled Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Guang'anmen Hospital of China Academy of Chinese Medical Sciences

collaborator.agency: Ministry of Science and Technology of the People´s Republic of China

clinical_study.source: Guang'anmen Hospital of China Academy of Chinese Medical Sciences

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators plan to conduct this multi-center, three-armed, randomized controlled trial to evaluate the efficacy of electroacupuncture (EA), compared with sham electroacupuncture (SA) and waiting list (WL) on participants with stress-predominant mixed urinary incontinence (MUI).

detailed_description.textblock: MUI tends to present with more severe symptoms and put greater burden on the health of individual and economy of society. Current European Association of Urology (EAU) guideline on incontinence recommends to initiate treatment targeted at predominant component of MUI. However, as to whether the interventions for stress urinary incontinence (SUI) can be effectively generalized to stress-predominant MUI, there is still no powerful evidence to support it. It is necessary to seek for interventions specific to stress-predominant MUI. Results of previous studies indicated that acupuncture might help to relieve the incontinence symptoms.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of participants with at least 50% reduction of mean 24-hour stress incontinence episode frequency (IEF) from baseline.
primary_outcome.description: The stress IEF will be documented in 3-day voiding diary.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of participants with at least 50% reduction of urinary leakage amount from baseline.
secondary_outcome.description: The urinary leakage amount will be measured by 1 hour pad test.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of urinary leakage amount from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: The urinary leakage amount will be measured by 1 hour pad test.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of participants with at least 50% reduction of mean 24-hour stress IEF from baseline.
secondary_outcome.description: The stress IEF will be documented in 3-day voiding diary.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of mean 24-hour IEF from baseline.
secondary_outcome.description: The IEF will be documented in 3-day voiding diary.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of mean 24-hour stress IEF from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: The stress IEF is documented in 3-day voiding diary.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of participants with at least 50% reduction of mean 24-hour IEF from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: The IEF will be documented in 3-day voiding diary.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of total and sub-score of International Consultation on Incontinence Questionnaire-short form (ICIQ-SF) from baseline.
secondary_outcome.description: ICIQ-SF questionnaire is a validated questionnaire to assess the severity of incontinence symptoms and influence on QoL in the past four weeks. The questionnaire includes items of IEF, urinary leakage amount and general influence on life to be scored. Total number of the score ranges from 1 to 21, with higher scores representing greater severity and 2.52 as minimal clinically important differences.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of mean 24-hour pad consumption from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: The pad consumption will be documented in 3-day voiding diary.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of participants with adequate improvement assessed by Patient global impression improvement (PGI-I).
secondary_outcome.description: PGI-I is a global index, with only one item, used to rate the participants' subject perception on symptom improvement. Participants will describe their impression from very much better to very much worse. Adequate Improvement is defined as the response of"much better" or "very much better".

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of mean 24-hour urgency episodes from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: The urgency episodes will be documented in 3-day voiding diary.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of mean 24-hour micturition episodes from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: The micturition episodes will be documented in 3-day voiding diary.

other_outcome.measure: Participants' expectations of improvement to urinary incontinence
other_outcome.description: Participants in the three groups will be asked: How do you expect your urinary incontinence to be in two months? Participants will choose the answer form the following options: Much better; Better; Don't know; Same; Worse；

other_outcome.measure: Participants' belief that acupuncture might help
other_outcome.description: In EA and SA groups, participants will be asked the question: Do you think your incontinence problem may be helped by acupuncture? Participants will choose the answer from the following options: Very ineffective; Fairly ineffective; Can't decide; Effective; Very effective；
Adverse events and severe adverse events will be recorded in case report form, whether related to interventions or not.

other_outcome.time_frame: Within 5 minutes after the last treatment at week 8
other_outcome.description: Participants in both EA and SA groups will be asked the question: do you think you have received traditional EA? Participants will choose the answer between the options of Yes or No.

arm_group.description: Participants in EA group will receive treatment at bilateral Bladder Meridian (BL) 33 [Zhongliao], BL35 [Huiyang] and Spleen Meridian (SP) 6 [Sanyinjiao]. The EA treatment will last 30mins for each session, 3 sessions a week (ideally every other day) for a succession of 8 weeks.

Participants in SA group will receive treatment at bilateral sham BL33 [Zhongliao], sham BL35 [Huiyang] and sham SP6 [Sanyinjiao]. The SA treatment will last 30mins for each session, 3 sessions a week (ideally every other day) for a succession of 8 weeks.

Participants in WL group will be followed up for 20 weeks. Participants only receive healthcare education and advice on lifestyle modification, which will be received by all the participants in the three groups.

intervention.description: BL33 is located in the third posterior sacral foramen; BL35, 0.5 cun (≈10mm) lateral to the extremity of the coccyx; and SP6 posterior to the medial border of the tibia, 3 cun superior to the prominence of the medial malleolus. BL33 will be inserted by needles of 0.30×75mm size at the angle of 45°, inward and downward, till the depth of 60-70mm. BL35 will be inserted by needles of 0.30×75mm size, slightly outward and upward, till the depth of 60-70mm. SP6 will be inserted by needles of 0.30×40mm till the depth of 25-30mm. All the needles will be lifted, thrust and twisted evenly for three times, right after insertion, to induce the sensation of deqi. Electronic acupuncture apparatus (Yingdi KWD 808 I electro pulse acupuncture therapeutic apparatus, Changzhou Yingdi Electronic Medical Device Co., Ltd) will be connected to the three pairs of needles transversally, with continuous wave of 20 Hertz (Hz), electric current of 2-6.5 milliampere (mA) for BL33 and BL35, and 1mA-3.5mA for SP6.

Sham BL33 is in the area of 1 cun (≈20mm) horizontally outside BL33; sham BL35, 1 cun (≈20mm) horizontally outside BL35; Sham SP6, in the middle of SP6 and tendons. The three pairs of acupoints will be inserted by needles of 0.30×40mm size to a depth of 2-3mm till the needles can stand still. No manipulations will be conducted, and the sensation of deqi will not be induced. Electronic acupuncture apparatus (Yingdi KWD 808 I electro pulse acupuncture therapeutic apparatus, Changzhou Yingdi Electronic Medical Device Co., Ltd) will be connected to the three pairs of needles transversally, with continuous wave of 20Hz and minimal electric current (ideally at a degree which participant can just percept). In about 30 seconds, the electric current will be turned off, leaving the indicator light and ticking sound on.

overall_official.affiliation: Guang'anmen Hospital of China Academy of Chinese Medical Sciences

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Guang'anmen Hospital of China Academy of Chinese Medical Sciences
responsible_party.investigator_title: Dean of Acupuncture Department of Guang'anmen Hospital

patient_data.ipd_description: Individual participant data that underline the results reported in the article after deidentification, excluding the private information of participants.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Beginning immediately after publication and ending 6 months following article publication
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Proposals should be directed to zhishunjournal@163.com. To gain access, data requestors wil need to sign a data access agreement and offer payment.
